caption: Pretty cool park situated at the end of la coul√©e verte. Lots of equipment that looks fun for kids but also includes exercise equipment which I took advantage of!

This is a little gem and very underestimated. You can walk through Paris for several kilometers in this former highline, that is now transformated to a highline pedestrian park (like In New York) where you will enjoy beautiful flowers and green plants, while walking high above the streets with great views over the different Boulevards and surprisingly quit considering the traffic beneath. Excellent for a run as well. About midway there is a public toilet and also an outdoor crossfit area with bars to do pull-ups, sit-ups, dipps and so on. There are benches along the way. The parkwalk starts about 400 m south of the Place de Bastille. Enjoyüòä I did
I love the place. Beautiful city garden. Summertime is blooming with flowers and winter it has its unique feeling...
Nice little square where you can have a picnic or play with your kids.
This park is a lovely rural urban park and is the southern terminus of the Paris highline, also worth a visit.
Place for relaxing can take breath, lunch
Nice place for a picnic
Little hidden gem
Ok
too many childs
Cool
Ok

An astonishing square on several levels, well planted with trees, it has several play areas. French poet, writer and essayist, Charles P√©guy (1873-1914) is also known under the pen names Pierre Deloire and Pierre Baudouin. The square is a terraced garden whose central point is decorated with a succession of flowered terraces. A more mineral space is organized as an amphitheater.
It is a very beautiful park which starts from the green corridor to arrive on one side in a small street and on the other side on the small ring road. Very pleasant hike.

A super beautiful park which evolves over time and is better and better maintained, there are quite a few games for children, you also have ping-pong tables to play and, it seems to me, checkers and chess.  The park has really become magnificent, super well maintained, there are no more plastic bins and well done for our planet, you will also find sports machines there, the park is truly sublime.

A charming hilly square divided into two spaces: a steep shade garden and a sunny garden housing children's games.  The shade garden is laid out like an undergrowth. In the shade of a soothing foliage of birches and hornbeams, shrubs and shade-loving perennials flourish. Hydrangeas, ferns and pachysanders have a field day offering a magnificent shades of more or less tender greens.  Surrounded by august catalpas and fertile lime trees, the sun garden charms us with its colors during this summer period.  Cosmos, cleomes and honeysuckle offer you a dance as fragrant as it is colorful.  At the exit or entrance to the square, depending on your direction of visit, don't miss a spectacular double massif. Sages, marigolds and petunias combined in a beautiful white-purple accord, we will thank you for your visit.  Congratulations to the gardeners for this magnificent example of design that is as beautiful as it is thoughtful. It‚Äôs very inspiring! üëè
Very beautiful green setting in Paris 12th. Games for children. Beautiful vegetation to find a little freshness in summer. Attached to the small belt.
On the road to the inner ring road we find this park with shared gardens. Super pleasant green place. It's just a shame that it closes at 5:30 p.m. in October....
the garden is well maintained, it is pleasant when there are few people. The guards on the other hand make me smile a lot, they are very permissive with people who smoke...
Very pleasant garden. Benches in the sun or shade depending on the weather with quiet areas for reading. Well maintained and eco-friendly. Even on a sunny Sunday there are not too many people.
It's pretty and pleasant enough to read a book at lunchtime or share a sandwich with friends. Quiet and clean place.
Charming little square, calm and relaxing with magnificent weather this November 14, which allows access to the Ren√© Dumont green corridor. Nice walk!
Very beautiful park Shaded and quiet to enjoy nature
Nice square, several levels, an almost wooded area and another with games for children.
A very pretty, well-shaded park.  Rather flowery. Fresh water and games for children. Possibility of joining the Coul√©e verte at the end of the shared seeds
Great park, shaded in the afternoon which is not always easy to find!

Very beautiful park which has evolved over the last 25 years. I went to school in Montempoivre until the beginning of the 2000s. As soon as the bell rang...hop towards Charles Peguy Square. There was a pool near the Montempoivre entrance at the time, it was a mini pool in summer for children. A spider isn't bad either. There was also a pool upstairs where there are some sports equipment. As well as ping pong tables which have changed places several times. The still relatively recent extension which allows you to reach the rails is also super nice üòÅ A beautiful place to walk and get some fresh air
Possible connection with the small belt to the south and with the green belt to the north

The square is well equipped, the games for children are good. It‚Äôs a shame that the childminders present are, some of them, hypnotized by their phones and do not monitor their children. As a result, it becomes a nightmare for little ones who cannot enjoy the games.

At the crossroads of the small belt and the planted promenade, you arrive at the square via a pretty path from the little belt. Take the time to observe the numerous trees (conifers, deciduous trees, palm trees), the beautiful plantations in the park, the shared garden with venerable rosemary trees. The games for children are great (1 to 12 years old), table tennis, chess games And don't forget that pretty dogs and cats are prohibited on the small belt, because they do not resist and will disturb birds and lewards which disappear from the small belt. Thanks for the tits
Very pretty, well hidden park! For young and old.
Very beautiful park! With great children's games (from 2 years old), a large spider web for older children - ping pong tables and direct access to the small belt.

It is a very large square in which everyone can find what they are looking for. There are areas for ping-pong games and others for small children. All around there are very shaded benches for people who want to rest.

Very well maintained garden. Games for little ones: sandbox, structures. Ping-pong tables and spider web structure for older children. Toilets. Access to shared gardens. Very flowery in spring. Bird songs. A very pleasant place.
Very nice for children aged 2 to 10
Not very secure places, avoided

Small, pleasant square for little ones Correction of September 21, 2021: the rope pyramid has been closed for a short period for more than 2 months (mid-July) without further information. 2 months, in the middle of summer. No one from the town hall can provide information on its repair, or even on the reason for closure. In the meantime, the children will play there. Does anyone take care of it at town hall?

My child loves this square which is accessed via the green corridor. Play areas for young and old as well as a sandbox. Ping-pong tables, and small plot of land with shared spaces to cultivate. Public toilets, however, are often closed.
